# Castilian Spanish tonal inventory {.transition}

## Castilian Spanish tonal inventory

| Pitch accents   | iP boundary tones| IP boundary tones            |
|:----------------|-----------------:|-----------------------------:|
| H*              | L-               | L%                           |
| L*              | !H-              | !H%                          |
| L+H*            | H-               | H%                           |
| L+Â¡H*           | LH-              | HL%                          |
| L+<H*           | HL-              | LH%                          |
| L*+H            | LHL-             | L!H%                         |
| H+L*            |                  | LHL%                         |

# Differences from English {.transition}

## No phrase accents!

::: {.fragment}
Unlike English, phrase accents aren't needed to explain F0 movements on unaccented syllables
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
But [don't]{.emph} get confused!
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
[There are still boundary tones associated with the iP!](https://sp-tobi.upf.edu/labelling_system/tonal_representation/boundary_tones/bI3/lhb)
:::

## Information structure

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
::: {.fragment .semi-fade-out} 
Mariano habla del tiempo.

Mariano talks about the weather
:::
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
::: {.fragment .semi-fade-out}
What does Mariano talk about?

Mariano habla del [tiempo]{.emph}.
:::
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
::: {.fragment .semi-fade-out}
Who talks about the weather?

Habla del tiempo [Mariano]{.emph}.
:::
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
::: {.fragment .semi-fade-out}
Who talks about what?

[Mariano]{.emph} habla del [tiempo]{.emph}.
:::
:::
